item.title: Developer Roadmap 2025: Skills You Need to Get Hired
item.description:
Let me be blunt: the developer job market in 2025 is different from what it was three years ago.

AI tools are everywhere. Companies are pickier. Junior roles are competitive. And yet, software development jobs are projected to grow 17% through 2033 — way faster than most careers.

The developers who struggle? They’re learning outdated skills, skipping fundamentals, or drowning in tutorial hell without ever building real projects.

The developers who get hired? They understand what companies actually need, focus on the right skills, and prove they can build things that work.

item.title: Best Programming Language to Learn in 2025 for Beginners
item.description:
So you’ve decided to learn programming. Smart move. But now you’re stuck staring at a list of languages that sounds like alphabet soup — Python, JavaScript, Java, C++, Go, Rust — and wondering which one won’t make you want to throw your laptop out the window.

I’ve been there. And I’ve watched countless beginners get paralyzed by this exact decision, spending weeks researching instead of actually coding. Here’s the truth: the “best” language depends entirely on what you want to build and where you want to work.
